actualResults.title: Missing Security Headers
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application is missing multiple critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security) and discloses technology stack via Server header. This is a valid security finding not covered in the expected vulnerabilities.

actualResults.title: Absence of CSRF Protection Tokens
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application lacks CSRF protection mechanisms including tokens, custom headers, and SameSite cookie flags. This is a valid security vulnerability not included in the expected findings.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure - Broken Challenge Link and Incomplete Feature
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application displays a broken link to non-existent endpoint and discloses technology stack. Valid security finding related to information disclosure and poor configuration.

actualResults.title: Missing Authentication and Authorization Controls on Root Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The application lacks any authentication mechanism on all endpoints including the root. Critical architectural vulnerability allowing unrestricted access without credentials.

actualResults.title: Missing Authorization Checks on Protected Endpoint (/level13)
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - While XSS was identified on /level13, this finding specifically highlights the missing authorization/authentication checks that should prevent unauthenticated access. The HTTP 500 response indicates the endpoint attempted to process the request without authentication verification first.

actualResults.title: Complete Absence of Access Control and User Isolation - No Function-Level Access Controls
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - Critical architectural vulnerability revealing no authentication system, no authorization system, no user isolation, and no function-level access controls. This is a fundamental security architecture failure not covered in expected findings.

actualResults.title: Application Instability and Potential Denial of Service on /level13
actualResults.assessment: New discovery - The /level13 endpoint crashes and enters an unrecoverable error state when processing certain payloads, causing persistent HTTP 500 errors. This represents a denial of service vulnerability and availability threat not included in expected findings.

matched.matchReason: Both findings describe a reflected XSS vulnerability with insufficient blacklist filtering. The expected finding references 'xss13' endpoint with blacklist bypass, and the actual finding confirms XSS on /level13 with similar blacklist bypass techniques (SVG/slash separator). The vulnerability class, attack vector (blacklist bypass), and impact (arbitrary JavaScript execution) are semantically identical. The endpoint naming difference may be due to documentation vs. actual implementation.
